com.ftpos.library.smartpos.nfcreader

Class NfcReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftpos.library.smartpos.nfcreader.NfcReader

  • public class NfcReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Copyright (C), 2015-2020,FEITIAN Technologies Co., Ltd. All rights reserved. NFC card operation interface. Note: The module works with high power consumption, so the card reader should be turned off after completing the necessary tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static NfcReader getInstance(android.content.Context context)

      • openCard

        public void openCard(int waitSeconds,
                     OnNfcReaderCallback onNfcReaderCallback)
        This method is used to wait for the user to present the contactless card.
        Parameters:
        waitSeconds - The maximum waiting time in seconds. If the value is 0, it indicates waiting 30 seconds.
        onNfcReaderCallback - Listen to the callback of the NFC card swipe operation.

      • openFelica

        public void openFelica(int waitSeconds,
                       int slots,
                       int systemCode,
                       OnNfcReaderCallback onNfcReaderCallback)
        This method is used to wait for the user to present a Felica card.
        Parameters:
        waitSeconds - The maximum waiting time in seconds. If the value is 0, it indicates waiting 30 seconds.
        slots - The number of time slots for the card to answer should be set to 1 if there are no special requirements.
        systemCode - The system code of the card, 16 bits. In the polling phase, only the cards with the same system code will respond.
        onNfcReaderCallback - Listen to the callback of the a Felica card swipe operation.

      • openCardEx

        public void openCardEx(int waitSeconds,
                       OnNfcPollingCallback onNfcPollingCallback)
        This method is used to wait for the user to present the contactless card.
        Parameters:
        waitSeconds - The maximum waiting time in seconds. If the value is 0, it indicates waiting 30 seconds.
        onNfcPollingCallback - Listen to the callback of the NFC card swipe operation.

      • openCardExSyn

        public int openCardExSyn(int waitMillisecond,
                         ISO14443_PollingInfo iso14443_pollingInfo)
        This method is used to wait for the user to present the contactless card.
        Parameters:
        waitMillisecond - The maximum waiting time in millisecond.
        iso14443_pollingInfo - Listen to the callback of the NFC card swipe operation.
        Returns:
        Refer toErrCode

      • close

        public int close()
        This method is used to turn off the radio frequency field of the contactless card reader.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • felicaSendApdu

        public int felicaSendApdu(int timeout,
                          byte[] sendData,
                          int sendDataLen,
                          byte[] response,
                          int[] responselen)
        This method is used to send the APDU command to Felica and get the response data. This method does not do anything with the response data returned by the card.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum waiting time in milliseconds.
        sendData - The APDU data.
        sendDataLen - The length of the APDU data.
        response - Response data from the card.
        responselen - The length of response data from the card.
        Returns:
        Refer toErrCode

      • isExist

        public boolean isExist()
        This method is used to check if a contactless card is present. Please note that, when calling, this method will reset the card. Also, this method will return false if there are multiple cards in a collision or other errors.
        Returns:
        The state of the card. If the returned value is true, it indicates a card exists, otherwise no card exists.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        cancel wait card

      • sendApduCustomer

        public int sendApduCustomer(byte[] sendData,
                            int sendDataLen,
                            byte[] apduResponse,
                            int[] apduResponselen)
        This method is used to send APDU to the contactless card (EMV card or NON-EMV card) and get the response data. This method does nothing with the response data returned by the card, for example, if the card returns 61xx or 6Cxx, this method does no further processing.
        Parameters:
        sendData - The APDU data to be sent to the card.
        sendDataLen - The length of APDU.
        apduResponse - Response data of the card.
        apduResponselen - The length of response data from the card.
        Returns:
        Refer toErrCode

                                MifareKey key,
                                byte[] abUID)
        Performs MIFARE authentication on specified block with provided key.
        Parameters:
        iAddr - The block address where the authentication resides
        key - Password
        abUID - Card uid
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

        Returns:

                                  int endAddr,

        Parameters:

        endAddr - End address.
        outData - Read data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_c_BlockData

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_c_BlockData(int blockNum,
                                     byte[] inData,
                                     int inDataLen)
        The M0 card writes data to the Block. This function M0 EV1/M0 C is valid.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - Block num.
        inData - Data to be written
        inDataLen - The length of data to be written is 4 bytes.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_ReadCnt

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_ReadCnt(int addr,
                                 IntTypeValue val)
        Reads value data from the specified block address (value block number range: 00-02) and returns 3 bytes of value data.
        Parameters:
        addr - Read the value of address.
        val - Value data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_IncrementValue

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_IncrementValue(int addr,
                                        int value)
        Valid for 3 bytes before writing to the specified block address (value block number range: 00-02). This function M0_EV1 is valid.
        Parameters:
        addr - Value-added address.
        value - Value-added data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_PwdAuth

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_PwdAuth(byte[] pwd,
                                 BytesTypeValue PACK)
        M0 EV1 authentication instruction. This function M0 EV1 is valid.
        Parameters:
        pwd - Authentication key (default 4 bytes FF).
        PACK - Authentication correctly returns two bytes 00 00, the others are error.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_ReadSign

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_ReadSign(BytesTypeValue sign)
        Read the signature data of the card. This function M0 EV1 is valid.
        Parameters:
        sign - The signature data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_CheckTearingEvent

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_CheckTearingEvent(BytesTypeValue valid)
        Check if the counter value is valid. PBValid returns one byte BD if it is valid. No other values are valid. This function M0_EV1 is valid.
        Parameters:
        valid - Whether the return is valid.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_ev1_Vcsl

        public int mifare_ul_ev1_Vcsl(byte[] IID,
                              byte[] pcdCaps,
                              BytesTypeValue vctid)
        VEnable unique identity and return virtual card type (0x05). This function M0_EV1 is valid.
        Parameters:
        IID - installation identifier.
        pcdCaps - PCD capabilities
        vctid - virtual Card Type Identifier.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifare_ul_c_Authenticate

        public int mifare_ul_c_Authenticate(byte[] key)
        M0_C card authentication. To operate this interface, you need to set the key in the card in advance. M0_C card is valid.
        Parameters:
        key - 16-byte key.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • checkNFCCardreader

        public int checkNFCCardreader()
        Check if the contactless card reader is available. Please note: this function will change the current state of the card, it is recommended not to use it during the transaction.
        Returns:
        0: contactless card reader available; Other values: contactless card reader is not available.

      • desFireAuthenticate

        public int desFireAuthenticate(int keyNo,
                               byte[] key,
                               int keyLen,
                               int mode)
        Perform DesFire card certification or application certification.
        Parameters:
        keyNo - Key identification.
        key - The key value.
        keyLen - The number of bytes of the key value.
        mode - mode. Refer toDesFireAuthenticateMode
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireTransmit

        public int desFireTransmit(byte[] cmd,
                           int cmdLen,
                           byte[] recBuff,
                           int[] recLen,
                           int commMode,
                           int cmdType)
        DesFire sends the command and gets the response data.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command data.
        cmdLen - The length of the command data.
        recBuff - The number of bytes of response data. The caller must ensure that this buffer space is sufficient. It is recommended not less than 260 bytes.
        recLen - The length of the response data.
        commMode - Communication mode, used to determine the secure mode for command data and response data. See the DF_XXX macro definition. Refer toDesFireCommMode
        cmdType - The type of the command can be: 0-compatible with 7816-4 protocol; 1-Legacy mode;
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireTransmit

        public int desFireTransmit(byte[] cmd,
                           int cmdLen,
                           BytesTypeValue recvData,
                           int commMode,
                           int cmdType)
        DesFire sends the command and gets the response data.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command data.
        cmdLen - The length of the command data.
        recvData - The response data.
        commMode - Communication mode, used to determine the secure mode for command data and response data. See the DF_XXX macro definition.Refer toDesFireCommMode
        cmdType - The type of the command can be: 0-compatible with 7816-4 protocol; 1 - Legacy mode;
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireSelApp

        public int desFireSelApp(byte[] aid,
                         int aidLen,
                         DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        DesFire selects the app.
        Parameters:
        aid - Apply ID.
        aidLen - The number of bytes to apply the identity, currently must be 3.
        desFireResponse - Card response status and data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireGetInfo

        public int desFireGetInfo(int flag,
                          int id,
                          DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        DesFire gets information about a card, application, file, or key.
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag,Refer to DesFireGetInfoFlag
        id - When bFlag is getKeyVersion, it is keyNo; When bFlag is GetFileSettins, it is FileID.
        desFireResponse - Information about the card, application, file, or key.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireReadFile

        public int desFireReadFile(int fileType,
                           int fileId,
                           int offset,
                           int length,
                           DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        DesFire reads the file. An error should be returned when the offset or length read exceeds the file range.
        Parameters:
        fileType - File type. Refer to DesFireFileType 0: StdFile / BakFile; 1: RecordFile;
        fileId - file ID.
        offset - Offset address.
        length - Length to read.
        desFireResponse - The contents of the file read.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireWriteFile

        public int desFireWriteFile(int fileType,
                            int fileId,
                            int offset,
                            int length,
                            byte[] data,
                            DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        DesFire card writes the file. An error should be returned when the offset or length of the write exceeds the file range.
        Parameters:
        fileType - File type. Refer to DesFireFileType 0: StdFile / BakFile; 1: RecordFile;
        fileId - File ID.
        offset - Offset address.
        length - Length to write.
        data - The data to write.
        desFireResponse - Card response status and data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireValueFileOp

        public int desFireValueFileOp(int op,
                              int fileID,
                              byte[] data,
                              int dataLen,
                              DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        DesFire card value file action.
        Parameters:
        op - Operation type. Refer to DesFireValueFileOperationFlag
        fileID - File ID.
        data - Operating values.
        dataLen - The length of the data.
        desFireResponse - Card response status and data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • desFireComfirmCancel

        public int desFireComfirmCancel(boolean flag,
                                DesFireResponse desFireResponse)
        Operate to confirm or cancel the interface
        Parameters:
        flag - TRUE-confirm,FALSE-cancel.
        desFireResponse - Card response status and data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • nfcType1TagReadId

        public int nfcType1TagReadId(BytesTypeValue id)
        Read card ID data.
        Parameters:
        id - Returns the ID data, including two byte headers, and a 4-byte UID.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

        public int nfcType1TagReadByte(int address,
                               BytesTypeValue readData)

        Parameters:
        address - The address ranges from 0 to 0x78.
        readData - Read 1 byte of data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

        Parameters:
        readData - Reading card data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • nfcType1TagWrite

        public int nfcType1TagWrite(int address,
                            byte[] writeData)
        To write data of the specified length to the specified address.
        Parameters:
        address - Write address (0x0c-0x68).
        writeData - The data to be written.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifarePlusAuthentication

        public int mifarePlusAuthentication(int addr,
                                    int keyType,
                                    int mode,
                                    byte[] key)
        MifarePlus card authentication.
        Parameters:
        addr - 1-byte block num.(00~0xFF)
        keyType - 1-byte key type. (1: KeyA, 2: KeyB)
        mode - 1-byte secure message mode. (1: EV0, 2: EV1)
        key - 16-byte key.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifarePlusWriteData

        public int mifarePlusWriteData(int addr,
                               int commType,
                               int responseMode,
                               byte[] data)
        Write data.
        Parameters:
        addr - 1-byte block num.(00~0xFF)
        commType - 1-byte Communication type. (1: ciphertext, 0: plaintext)
        responseMode - 1-byte response mode. (1: with Mac, 0: without Mac)
        data - 16 bytes write data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifarePlusReadData

        public int mifarePlusReadData(int addr,
                              int commType,
                              int responseMode,
                              int commMode,
                              BytesTypeValue readData)
        Read card data.
        Parameters:
        addr - 1-byte block num.(00~0xFF)
        commType - 1-byte Communication type (1: ciphertext, 0: plaintext)
        responseMode - 1-byte response mode (1: with Mac, 0: without Mac)
        commMode - 1-byte command mode (1: with Mac, 0: without Mac)
        readData - Read card data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifarePlusReadBalance

        public int mifarePlusReadBalance(int addr,
                                 int commType,
                                 int responseMode,
                                 int commMode,
                                 IntTypeValue remainingSum)
        Read the balance.
        Parameters:
        addr - 1-byte block num.(00~0xFF)
        commType - 1-byte Communication type (1: ciphertext, 0: plaintext)
        responseMode - 1-byte response mode (1: with Mac, 0: without Mac)
        commMode - 1-byte command mode (1: with Mac, 0: without Mac)
        remainingSum - Card balance.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • mifarePlusOp

        public int mifarePlusOp(int cmd,
                        byte[] sendData,
                        int sendDataLen,
                        byte[] recvData,
                        int[] recvDataLen)
        Mifare Plus Operation command
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command to operation the card
        sendData - Data sent to the card
        sendDataLen - Length of the data sent to the card
        recvData - receive data from card
        recvDataLen - Length of the data from the card
        Returns:
        Error code. Refer toErrCode
